ARABIC: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and say: "Do you resolve to purify yourself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And say: 'Would you like to grow (in virtue)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and say to him: 'Are you willing to be purified,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: And say to him, "Would you like to reform yourself?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Tell him ‘Do you have the inclination to become pure?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And say to him: "Would you purify yourself"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then say: Have you (a desire) to purify yourself:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And say, "Hast thou the will to purify thyself;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And say (unto him): Hast thou (will) to grow (in grace)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then say thou: 'wouldst thou to be purified?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And say to him, 'Wouldst thou that thou shouldst be purified (from sin)?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And say to him: "Would you purify yourself (from the sin of disbelief by becoming a believer)",
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And say, “Do you care to be cleansed?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:18] and say, “Would you — I call you [to] — purify yourself (tazakkā: a variant reading has tazzakkā, where the original second tā’ [of tatazakkā] has been assimilated with the zāy), to purge yourself of idolatry, by bearing witness that there is no god but God,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And say (unto him): Hast thou) Pharaoh ((will) to grow (in grace)) will become righteous, surrender and believe in Allah's divine Oneness?
